meanings.definition: To find or prove guilty of a crime again.
meanings.sent1: The judge reconvicts the criminal after new evidence is presented.
meanings.sent2: The court reconvicts the suspect based on DNA analysis.
meanings.sent3: The detective reconvicts the culprit with the help of a clever witness.
meanings.sent4: The truth reconvicts the liar, revealing their deceitful ways.
meanings.sent5: The reconviction of the thief brings closure to the case.

meanings.definition: To sentence someone to prison again for a crime.
meanings.sent1: The judge reconvicts the offender to serve additional time behind bars.
meanings.sent2: The court reconvicts the convict for violating parole conditions.
meanings.sent3: The warden reconvicts the escapee, who tried to flee once more.
meanings.sent4: The law reconvicts the criminal, showing that justice prevails.
meanings.sent5: The reconviction of the prisoner serves as a warning to others.
